The decline followed news that Kuwait Oil Company is reviewing its capital expenditure after bids exceeded budget estimates, putting major tenders—where L T was the lowest bidder for over $4.5 billion—at risk.

articles.title: Biocon QIP to ease balance sheet pressure; metals, PSU banks favoured in near term: Nischal Maheshwari
articles.summary: Biocon's fundraising is viewed positively to manage debt. Expert Nischal Maheshwari is optimistic about Biocon's future, expecting earlier investments to yield returns. He also favors contract development and manufacturing firms like Laurus Labs. Maheshwari sees potential in banking, metals, and power sectors, particularly execution-focused players in power.

articles.title: Mukul Agrawal’s newest stock bet is up 10% in just 2 sessions. Do you own?
articles.summary: Despite pressure on smallcap stocks for most of 2025, Agrawal’s portfolio featured five multibagger names during the year, namely– Oseal Devices, Zelio E-Mobility, Monolithisch India, Zota Health Care, and ASM Technologies.

articles.title: Earnings better than expected, but IT sector still lacks growth visibility: Sandip Agarwal
articles.summary: India's top IT firms have started their earnings season with results slightly better than expected. Companies like TCS and HCL Tech are managing costs and benefiting from currency movements. However, underlying business growth remains slow. Experts suggest that while current performance is acceptable, significant demand revival is not yet visible.

articles.title: TCS management says strategic investments to continue across key growth pillars
articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services maintained its EBIT margin at 25.2% in the December quarter. This stability was achieved despite significant exceptional costs. Management highlighted productivity gains and operational efficiencies as key drivers. The company continues to invest in AI and future-ready skills. Workforce optimisation efforts are ongoing. TCS remains focused on long-term strategic priorities.

articles.title: Rs 3 lakh crore wipeout! Sensex sheds over 900 pts from day’s peak, Nifty sinks 1%.  5 factors behind market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities slipped on Tuesday after a brief morning rally, with benchmarks giving up early gains and wiping significant market value. Selling pressure was fueled by profit-taking in heavyweights, rising crude prices, foreign fund outflows, rupee weakness, and fragile technical momentum, leaving investors cautious amid persistent volatility.

articles.title: PMS Tracker: Quant, fintech strategies lead December gains of up to 8%; Kotak, Aequitas among top performers
articles.summary: Quant, fintech and diversified PMS strategies topped December’s charts with gains of up to 8%, even as several small-cap and thematic portfolios saw steep declines. The month underscored sharp dispersion in India’s PMS market, with systematic and sector-focused approaches outperforming while small-cap strategies faced significant selling pressure.

articles.title: Amagi Media Labs IPO Day 1: Subscribed just 4% in early hours. Check GMP and other key details
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs’ IPO opened to a muted response on Day 1, with overall subscription at just 4% in early trade. A modest grey market premium reflects cautious investor sentiment amid volatile markets and heightened scrutiny of tech valuations.

articles.title: Is silver at its peak?  Robert Kiyosaki explains why he’s not selling
articles.summary: Renowned investor Robert Kiyosaki cautions silver enthusiasts, suggesting the metal might be nearing a short-term peak. He anticipates a significant dip before any further price surge, advising patience. Kiyosaki, who has held silver since 1965, plans to continue buying up to $100, viewing current retail selling as potentially market-damaging.

articles.title: AI-led deal momentum improving; clients spend where ROI is visible: TCS management
articles.summary: TCS management says client demand is improving gradually, with spending focused on projects delivering clear ROI. AI-led deals are accelerating across sectors, with most large clients already engaged. The company expects momentum to sustain into Q4, says margins will be protected through delivery efficiency, and remains cautiously optimistic on FY26 revenue growth.

articles.title: CLSA flags margin recovery ahead for HDFC Bank, predicts 27% headroom despite weak start to the year
articles.summary: CLSA has reiterated its “Outperform” rating on HDFC Bank, setting a target price of ₹1,200 and implying over 27% upside from current levels despite recent stock weakness. The brokerage views concerns over deposit growth and margins as temporary and expects FY27 to be a bounce-back year.

articles.title: Buy or sell? What TCS, HCL Tech results mean for IT stocks after Rs 75,000 crore FII selloff
articles.summary: TCS posts mixed Q3 with margins under pressure, while HCL Technologies beats expectations with AI-driven growth. Sector sentiment is cautious after Rs 75,000-crore FII selloff, with brokerages suggesting stock-specific execution and AI traction will guide performance.

articles.title: Digital Real Estate: India’s REIT market still nascent, but long-term growth potential remains significant
articles.summary: India’s REIT market remains in its early stages, with REITs accounting for just 19% of listed real estate value versus the global average of 57%. Yet this gap signals strong long-term potential, driven by office assets, emerging retail and industrial REITs, and policy support, including SM-REITs, Vestian noted.

articles.title: Heavy Crude, Heavy Consequences: Why Venezuela’s shock tests Canada’s oil economy
articles.summary: A U.S. operation in Caracas and plans to assume control of Venezuela’s oil assets have revived heavy crude flows, posing a direct competitive threat to Canada. With U.S. refineries suited to Venezuelan grades, Canada risks losing market share, pressuring oil revenues and weighing on the Canadian dollar.

articles.title: Standing His Ground: Why Jerome Powell’s latest move marks a turning point
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is now openly confronting President Trump's criticism. This marks a significant shift as Powell defends the central bank's independence. Recent actions suggest a growing concern over political pressure. Powell's stance is seen as crucial for the institution's autonomy. This period will define his legacy as a central banker.

articles.title: NLC India shares gain 3% as board approves subsidiary listing, interim dividend
articles.summary: NLC India's shares surged following board approvals for its renewable energy arm's listing and a 36% interim dividend. The company plans to dilute up to 25% equity in NLC India Renewables Limited, aligning with national monetization goals.

articles.title: India bonds fall, reversing gears on Bloomberg index disappointment
articles.summary: Indian government bonds experienced a downturn Tuesday after Bloomberg Index Services postponed their inclusion in a global index, citing an ongoing review. This decision dashed market expectations of significant foreign inflows, impacting bond yields. Meanwhile, state debt auctions and a significant dollar-rupee swap by the RBI are also on the horizon, amidst broader geopolitical concerns.

articles.title: Meesho’s 129% post-IPO rally fizzles as stock slides 35% from peak amid valuation concerns. Buy, sell or hold?
articles.summary: Meesho’s sharp post-IPO rally has lost momentum as valuation concerns, lock-in expiry-related selling and cautious brokerage commentary weigh on the stock. While analysts flag limited near-term upside, the company’s strong user base, improving logistics efficiency, and differentiated e-commerce model continue to underpin its long-term business prospects.

articles.title: With NSE IPO in sight, is a BSE re-rating on cards? Here’s what analysts say
articles.summary: As SEBI moves closer to approving the long-awaited NSE IPO, analysts believe the listing could act as a key re-rating trigger for BSE by improving peer benchmarking, visibility, and investor interest, potentially narrowing the valuation gap between the two exchanges.

articles.title: Bloomberg keeps review of Indian bonds open amid operational hurdles
articles.summary: Bloomberg’s consultation on adding Indian government bonds to its Global Aggregate Index flagged concerns over post-trade tax-related settlement delays, limited automation in trading workflows and lengthy fund registration. While acknowledging India’s market reforms, respondents said broader benchmark inclusion demands higher operational efficiency. Bloomberg will continue its review and engagement through 2026.

articles.title: Gold and silver momentum high, but majority of move may be priced in: Ashi Anand
articles.summary: Metal stocks have seen a significant rally, with precious metals driven by geopolitical concerns and industrial metals like copper poised for growth due to AI investments. However, steel faces caution due to weak demand from China. The IT sector is bifurcated, with digital platforms showing long-term promise and traditional IT services anticipating AI-driven growth and margin improvements.

articles.title: Short-term relief or long-term risk? Trump’s proposed credit card rate cap explained
articles.summary: A proposed one-year cap on US credit card interest rates could help borrowers now. However, experts warn that this might reduce credit availability and hurt bank profits. The plan faces significant hurdles in Congress.

articles.title: Deepak Shenoy backs consumer-centric insurance reforms despite near-term distributor pain
articles.summary: Proposed insurance commission reforms aim to align incentives with consumer interests, potentially causing near-term disruption for distributors but strengthening the sector long-term. Meanwhile, India's listed retailers face challenges sustaining high valuations as slowing growth is offset by margin improvements, driven by increased competition and shifting consumer purchasing habits.

articles.title: Infosys Q3 results preview: PAT, revenue may grow by up to 9% YoY; FY26 guidance, deals pipeline in focus
articles.summary: Infosys' Q3 results are anticipated to show modest growth, with brokerages predicting a slight uptick in net profit and revenue. While near-term momentum might be tempered by seasonal factors, the focus will be on management's outlook for FY26, deal execution, and client spending trends amidst global economic uncertainties.

articles.title: Independence on Trial: Powell probe raises new questions for the Fed
articles.summary: The Federal Reserve chair is under a Justice Department criminal investigation concerning a $2.5 billion headquarters renovation. Prosecutors are examining if Jerome Powell misled Congress about the project's cost and scope. This development escalates White House tensions with the central bank and raises concerns about its independence.

articles.title: Sarvam AI and TN govt to establish sovereign AI park
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu has partnered with Sarvam AI to establish a Rs 10,000 crore Sovereign AI Park, aiming to create 1,000 deep-tech jobs. This initiative will build an independent AI ecosystem within the state, fostering local talent and ensuring data sovereignty.

articles.title: Spain moves to curb AI deepfakes, tighten consent rules on images
articles.summary: Spain's government has approved a new bill to combat AI deepfakes. The legislation will strengthen child protection and set 16 as the minimum age for image consent. It also limits the unauthorised use of AI-generated images and voices for commercial purposes. European Union nations are also moving to criminalise non-consensual sexual deepfakes by 2027.

articles.title: Voice AI startup Deepgram raises $130 million at $1.3 billion valuation
articles.summary: Voice AI startup Deepgram has secured $130 million in funding, valuing the company at $1.3 billion. This investment will fuel international expansion into Europe and Asia-Pacific. Deepgram also plans to develop new AI models and pursue strategic acquisitions.

articles.title: End of Q-Comm's 10-min era; Google meets Siri
articles.summary: Blinkit drops “10-minute delivery” claim after labour ministry intervention. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Quantum software company Haiqu raises $11 million
articles.summary: Haiqu, a quantum software startup, has secured $11 million in funding. The company aims to make quantum computing more accessible by reducing costs and improving hardware performance for larger applications.

articles.title: Malaysia to take legal action against X, xAI over Grok concerns
articles.summary: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) already suspended access to Grok, which is integrated into both the X and xAI platforms, on Sunday. It has now appointed solicitors to commence "legal proceedings" against X and xAI, the regulatory body said, without specifying what form the proceedings would take.

articles.title: Liquidnitro Games raises $19 million from Northpoint Capital, Nexus
articles.summary: The fresh capital will be used to scale the Hyderabad-based company’s AI-enabled game production and live services platform, expand its global operating footprint, and back co-investments with publishing partners, cofounder Sandeep Kowdley told ET in an interaction.

articles.title: Deeptech company Greentech raises Rs 30 crore from Transition VC
articles.summary: The company manages OEM-agnostic multi-brand wind assets and provides full-scope O M, predictive maintenance, data analytics, SCADA modernisation, component repairs and crane-less major component exchanges.

articles.title: Actress Samantha Prabhu’s perfume brand Secret Alchemist secures $3 million from Unilever Ventures, others
articles.summary: The round was a mix of primary and secondary capital. Of the total amount, $2.5 million was primary capital and the remainder was secondary, with a few early angel investors selling their stakes, cofounder Akash Valia told ET. The company plans to use the capital for branding and marketing, to widen its product portfolio, and expand the team.

articles.title: Why Apple has called on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone
articles.summary: The deal allowing Apple to tinto Google's AI technology was disclosed Monday in a joint statement from the Silicon Valley powerhouses. The partnership will draw upon Google's Gemini technology to customize a suite of AI features dubbed "Apple Intelligence" on the iPhone and other products.

articles.title: OpenAI acquires healthcare startup Torch, deal pegged at $100 million
articles.summary: Torch is a small healthcare technology startup which focusses on unifying fragmented medical data such as lab results, medications, and doctor visit records, into a single, AI-readable system.

articles.title: TCS headcount drops by 11,000 in Q3 after 19,000 in last quarter
articles.summary: At the end of the December quarter, TCS had 582,163 employees, lower than the September quarter’s count of 593,314, the Mumbai-headquartered firm reported. ​In the previous quarter, the company had reported a net reduction of 19,755 employees, taking its total workforce below six lakh.

articles.title: Meta plans to cut about 10% of employees in reality labs business
articles.summary: The cuts to Reality Labs -- which has roughly 15,000 employees -- could be announced as soon as Tuesday. The layoffs would be a fraction of Meta's total workforce of 78,000, but are set to disproportionately affect those in the metaverse unit who work on virtual reality headsets and a VR-based social network, said the people, who asked not to be identified since they were not authorized to discuss confidential decisions. The cuts could end up affecting more than 10% of the division, one of the p

articles.title: Instant househelp sector soars; TCS, HCLTech earnings
articles.summary: Happy Tuesday! India’s on-demand home services sector saw record orders in December. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: India can be global AI use case capital: MeitY Secretary
articles.summary: India should aim to become the global use case capital for artificial intelligence (AI) if the adoption of the technology is to be spread widely, electronics and information technology secretary S Krishnan said on Monday.

articles.title: HCLTech Q3 PAT dips 11% to Rs 4,076 crore
articles.summary: HCLTech posted a 3.75% sequential drop in net profit to Rs 4,076 crore, hit by one-time restructuring costs. Revenue exceeded expectations, while AI services grew to $146 million. The company plans to focus on high-growth areas such as AI and semiconductors, maintaining its operating margin guidance at 17-18%.

articles.title: TCS Q3 net profit declines 14% to Rs 10,657 crore on labour code rejig hit
articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services reported a 14% drop in net profit to Rs 10,657 crore for December 2025, hit by one-time severance and new labour code costs. Revenue grew 5% on-year to Rs 67,087 crore, with AI services showing strong growth. The board approved interim and special dividends.

articles.title: A new gig rises, will it scale up?
articles.summary: As AI models grow more complex, a new white-collar gig workforce has emerged to review and guide systems. A new category of AI-related work is unravelling in India, where professionals are paid not just to label data, but to review, validate, and guide artificial intelligence systems. Who are these humans-in-the-loop? Puran Choudhary explores

articles.title: ‘You can’t debug a billion parameters like software’:  Stanford's Jeffrey Ullman
articles.summary: Jeffrey Ullman, professor emeritus of computer science at Stanford University and a Turing Award laureate, speaks to Puran Choudhary about the limits of large models, AI risk, and India’s research challenge

articles.title: Quick beauty service platform Dazzl raises $3.2 million, led by Stellaris
articles.summary: On-demand beauty and wellness services platform Dazzl has raised $3.2 million in a round led by Stellaris Venture Partners.Angel investors Ritesh Agarwal, founder and CEO of Prism (formerly Oyo); Maninder Gulati, former Oyo CXO; Abhinav Sinha, founder of Kluisz AI; Sameer Brij Verma, founder of Northpoint Capital; and Abhishek Bansal, CEO and cofounder of Shadowfax, also participated in the round.

articles.title: Healthcare startup Sukino raises $31 million in round led by Bessemer
articles.summary: Zerodha’s investment arm, Rainmatter, participated in the funding round of the Bengaluru-based startup, which provides long-term healthcare services for patients with chronic conditions. Per chief executive Rajinish Menon, the fresh funds will be used for expanding its new geographies and adding more services to its offerings.

articles.title: India gearing up AI Infrastructure for large-scale adoption: Nasscom
articles.summary: India is strategically positioning itself to build robust AI infrastructure across the value chain, mirroring the success it achieved in the digital space, according to Ashish Aggarwal, Vice President of Public Policy at Nasscom.

articles.title: AI did it in one prompt: Shopify CEO Tobi Lutke builds his own MRI viewer
articles.summary: Lutke’s X post said he used Anthropic’s Claude AI to process DICOM files (the standard file format used in healthcare to store and transmit MRIs, CT scans, and X-rays) from an MRI scan. The AI-based system organised radiology reports and images and generated a browser-based tool, which ran on his computer.

articles.title: Google and Apple enter into multi-year AI deal for Gemini models
articles.summary: Alphabet said on Monday that it has signed a multi-year agreement with Apple, under which Apple’s next generation of AI models will be built using Google’s Gemini technology.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the mightiest - Part 8: How to read the yield curve, and use it to gain an edge in the markets
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Delhi Metro phase 5A approved: 13 stations, 16 km corridor at ₹12,015 crore
Beyond 1 crore WhatsApp bans; Oyo's third attempt at IPO
articles.summary: The government wants to know more about accounts banned by WhatsApp in India. This and more in today’s ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: India’s manufacturing woes: Rahul Gandhi’s prescription for job creation
School assembly news headlines for December 23: Top national, international business & sports updates
articles.summary: Political sparring intensifies with a jibe at Akhilesh Yadav, while a former Trinamool leader criticizes Mamata Banerjee. International news includes NASA's diamond-planet discovery and a former child star's homelessness. Sports headlines feature Usman Khawaja's family facing abuse, and business news highlights soaring gold prices and Thailand's popularity as an Indian holiday spot.

articles.title: Vivek Ramaswamy mauled in MAGA bloodletting as Trump devotees turn on each other
articles.summary: A conservative conference saw prominent MAGA figures engage in bitter public disputes. Vivek Ramaswamy faced backlash for his remarks on anti-Indian hate. Ben Shapiro criticized Tucker Carlson and Candace Owens. Steve Bannon also attacked Shapiro. The event became a spectacle of internal conflict, with accusations of antisemitism and conspiracy theories dominating the proceedings.

articles.title: Indian Overseas Bank cuts overnight MCLR by 5 bps
articles.summary: The one-month MCLR stands at 8.30%, three-month at 8.40%, six-month at 8.65%, and the one-year MCLR at 8.80%. The two-year MCLR is also unchanged at 8.80%, while the three-year MCLR continues at 8.85%.

articles.title: 10 bizarre animals that look like they came from another planet
articles.summary: From deep-sea sharks to translucent frogs, these extraordinary creatures showcase bizarre adaptations and appearances so unusual they seem almost extraterrestrial, highlighting the strange wonders of Earth’s biodiversity.

articles.title: Not the first time:  A timeline of Iran’s major protests over the last 30 years
articles.summary: Iran has seen several large-scale protest movements over the last 30 years, with many raising hopes of political change. Here’s a timeline of the biggest uprisings, how long they lasted, and why they ended.

articles.title: US inflation eases in December as core prices show slowdown
articles.summary: The 2.6% annual rise in core CPI in the US marks the slowest pace of inflation since March 2021. On a headline basis, the all-items CPI rose 0.3% for the month and 2.7% year-on-year, matching both November’s increase and consensus estimates.

articles.title: Trump administration labels 3 Muslim brotherhood branches as terrorist organisations
articles.summary: President Donald Trump sanctioned Lebanese, Jordanian, and Egyptian Muslim Brotherhood branches as terrorist organizations, impacting US ties with Qatar and Turkey and affecting immigration policies.

articles.title: Uday Kotak family office USK Capital acquires majority stake in US healthy-snacking brand Go Raw
articles.summary: USK Capital, the family office of Uday Kotak, has acquired a majority stake in US-based seed-centric snacking brand Go Raw, marking its first overseas and consumer sector investment.

articles.title: CTC vs take-home: How your salary structure impacts your net pay
articles.summary: Your headline CTC rarely reflects what actually lands in your bank account. As Kuljeet Singh, Chief Financial Officer at GI Group Holding, explains, the way salary components are structured plays a decisive role in determining take-home income. With the new labour codes and tax rules shaping compensation in FY2025–26, understanding salary structure is now critical for both short-term cash flow and long-term financial security.

articles.title: Political and industry leaders hail move to end 10-minute delivery branding
articles.summary: The government’s intervention comes amid mounting scrutiny of ultra-fast delivery promises and their impact on delivery partners operating under tight time pressure on India’s congested roads.

articles.title: Cybersecurity firm CloudSEK raises USD 10 mn from Connecticut Innovations
articles.summary: The predictive cyber threat intelligence firm has raised the funds at an enterprise valuation of close to USD 200 million. With this round, the company has raised USD 29 million to date.

articles.title: US tariff on Iran trade partners unlikely to impact India: Govt
articles.summary: India’s trade with Iran accounts for just 0.15% of total trade, government sources say, with trade value expected to subside further.

articles.title: Raamdeo Agrawal's big call: Auto will be the star sector in 2026
articles.summary: The veteran investor also maintained a positive view on PSU-led themes, particularly PSU banks, citing attractive valuations and earnings growth that continues to outpace private sector peers. Large caps, in general, were highlighted as better positioned than mid and small caps in the current market phase.

articles.title: Happy Pongal 2026: Top wishes, messages, and quotes to share

articles.title: Trump changed the rules, China woke up, and Indian IT has a problem: Manish Chokhani

articles.title: Omaxe to invest ₹500 crore in Ludhiana mixed-use project; seeks focus on urban infra, connectivity
articles.summary: Omaxe Ltd invests ₹500 crore in Omaxe Chowk, Ludhiana, a luxury retail and residential project at Ghumar Mandi, set for completion by June 2030 under RLDA partnership.

articles.title: Your salary has hidden tax rules: Which allowances get taxed, are partly spared or fully free?
articles.summary: What appears as extra pay on a salary slip can quietly raise or reduce your tax burden. Income tax law treats different allowances differently, determining which are fully taxable, which get limited exemptions, and which remain tax-free — along with the conditions employees must meet.

articles.title: Courts can’t compel lawyers to disclose sources of client documents: Delhi HC
articles.summary: Delhi High Court quashed a sessions court order, affirming lawyers cannot be forced to reveal document sources due to attorney-client privilege under Section 126, in the McDonald’s case.

articles.title: Tata Elxsi Q3 Results | Steady revenue growth, profit falls 30% sequentially
articles.summary: Tata Elxsi delivered mixed Q3 results on Tuesday, with revenue showing steady growth while net profit softened sequentially.

articles.title: ICICI Lombard Q3 Results | Net profit falls 9% as combined ratio worsens to 105%
articles.summary: ICICI Lombard reported a 9% year-on-year decline in Q3 net profit to ₹659 crore as a higher combined ratio offset double-digit growth in total income and net premium earned. Net income increased 12%.

articles.title: UN rights office says hundreds killed in Iran protests
articles.summary: The U.N. human rights chief said on Tuesday that he was "horrified" by mounting violence by Iran's security forces against peaceful protesters, with the U.N. citing its own sources as saying that hundreds have been killed so far.

articles.title: From Chasnala to Asansol: India’s deadliest and most devastating coal mine accidents
articles.summary: A coal mine collapse in West Bengal’s Asansol on Tuesday, January 13, has once again highlighted the dangers linked to coal mining in India. Over the decades, poor safety systems, illegal extraction, and weak monitoring have led to some of the country’s worst industrial tragedies. Here is a look at eight of the most serious mining disasters in India.

articles.title: PB Fintech unveils new retirement planning platform Pensionbazaar
articles.summary: New PB Fintech initiative aims to enable end-to-end retirement planning for Indian investors. Pensionbazaar will offer a range of retirement-focused financial products, including NPS, annuities and pension-linked ULIPs.

articles.title: Is 10-minute delivery banned? Experts say no, tagline removal largely optics
articles.summary: Quick commerce platforms, including Blinkit, Zepto and Swiggy, have reportedly been asked to scale back '10-minute delivery' branding after a government nudge. Industry experts say the move is largely optics-driven, not business-altering.

articles.title: Trade Setup on January 14: Volatile Nifty heads into another expiry with 25,700 being a key options support
articles.summary: Bears remained in control for the better part of Tuesday's session, pushing the Nifty down to an intraday low of 25,603. However, a late rebound of more than 150 points in the final hour helped limit losses and pull the index off the day's lows.

articles.title: Reliance Industries Q3 Preview: O2C seen driving growth; oil & gas under pressure
articles.summary: Brokerage firm Jefferies expects Reliance Industries’ O2C segment to drive Q3FY26 earnings on the back of stronger refining margins, while lower production and gas prices may weigh on the oil and gas business.

articles.title: India gets its first autistic Barbie doll: Averted gaze to noise-cancelling headphones, here are its features
articles.summary: Mattel spent 18 months creating this Barbie, working closely with the Autistic Self Advocacy Network (ASAN).

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO becomes second-most subscribed PSU issue, just behind Mazagon Dock
articles.summary: Currently, Bharat Coking Coal's shares are trading at a premium of ₹10.7 in the unlisted market, including a GMP premium of 48% compared to the issue price. However, these reports are speculative and the actual listing price may differ compared to the GMP rates.

articles.title: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visits Bosch campus in Bengaluru
articles.summary: Guruprasad Mudlapur, President of the Bosch Group in India and MD of Bosch Limited, hosted the high-powered delegation at the company’s headquarters, where innovations developed in the region were showcased.

articles.title: Canadian prime minister visits China after nearly a decade of tense relations
articles.summary: Carney agreed to visit China last October when he and Chinese President Xi Jinping met in South Korea. It was an encounter that offered no breakthroughs but suggested potential for deeper ties after a fractious relationship under former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau

articles.title: IRDAI set to release consultation paper on capping insurance commissions next month
articles.summary: According to sources, IRDAI may propose a return to segmental commission caps, similar to the older regulatory framework. This would mean setting separate commission limits for different insurance categories such as motor, health, term life, and other life and general insurance segments.

articles.title: Two oil tankers attacked near key CPC terminal in Black Sea
articles.summary: Prior to the attack, the vessels had moved away from the CPC facility, awaiting their turn to collect the cargoes, the person said. The extent of the damage to both ships wasn’t immediately clear.

articles.title: Beauty startup VCare targets market leadership, IPO in 1-2 years: CEO
articles.summary: With a market turnover nearing ₹400 crore and a target to become India's number one aesthetic brand in the next fiscal, VCare is laying the groundwork for an IPO, expected in the next 1-2 years after consolidation of its North India operations.

articles.title: Ecologist Vijay Dhasmana On The Aravallis Controversy & Delhi’s Air Crisis
articles.summary: India recorded the world’s highest increase in greenhouse gas emissions in 2023–24, adding 165 million tonnes of CO₂ to the atmosphere, as cities expand faster than nature can recover. At a time when climate action is often reduced to quick fixes and viral tree-planting drives, ecologist and rewildling expert Vijay Dhasmana reminds us that true ecological restoration demands patience, scientific rigour, and respect for natural systems.Over the decades, Dhasmana has worked across wildlife conserv

articles.title: No nuclear talks with Pakistan during Operation Sindoor: Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi
articles.summary: Indian Army chief says forces were fully prepared for ground operations, confirms Operation Sindoor is ongoing, and dismisses nuclear rhetoric as political amid US President Trump's relentless claims of mediation.

articles.title: Telangana BJP slams CM Revanth Reddy’s auto-debit traffic fine proposal
articles.summary: Reacting to the Reddy’s remarks on stricter enforcement of traffic rules, Telangana BJP President Rao said that while the BJP does not support violation of traffic norms, the proposed mechanism raises serious privacy concerns, pointing to an earlier instance where the Congress had opposed the Centre’s Sanchar Saathi initiative, claiming it would invade citizens’ personal space.

articles.title: Maharashtra announces four-day liquor ban ahead of civic polls; stock markets shut on polling day
articles.summary: Maharashtra imposes a four-day dry period in 29 municipal corporation areas for elections. Mumbai, Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad vote on January 15. BSE and NSE will be closed that day.

articles.title: Fare calculation method a 'trade secret', Railways tell CIC; RTI appeal dismissed
articles.summary: Indian Railways called its fare calculation a trade secret under RTI Act Section 8, rejecting a request for Paschim Superfast Express ticket details.

articles.title: Global central banks back Federal Reserve, stress importance of independence
articles.summary: Global central banks backed Jerome Powell and the US Fed, emphasizing that central bank independence is crucial for economic and financial stability.

articles.title: Amagi IPO: CEO says move to profit is structural, not a listing clean-up
articles.summary: Bhaskar Subramaniam, co-founder, MD and CEO of Amagi Media Labs, said the company expects profitability to scale as the business matures, with a potential steady-state EBITDA margin of around 25% over the next two to three years, in line with global vertical software peers.

articles.title: French far-right leader Le Pen faces appeal trial that could decide her 2027 presidential run
articles.summary: Marine Le Pen appeals her embezzlement conviction in Paris, risking a ban from the 2027 presidential race as National Rally leads polls and Jordan Bardella emerges as her possible successor.

articles.title: Tired of 'market risk' in retirement? NPS may soon offer assured payouts
articles.summary: PFRDA forms a 15-member expert committee led by Dr M S Sahoo to draft assured payout regulations for NPS, aiming to boost retirement income security and strengthen India’s pension ecosystem.

articles.title: Jaishankar rolls out new BRICS 2026 logo
articles.summary: S Jaishankar unveiled the BRICS 2026 logo and website in Delhi as India prepares to chair BRICS, marking its 20th anniversary and focusing on resilience, innovation and cooperation.

articles.title: Metropolis plans to expand genomics test menu to 500 in next two years
articles.summary: Metropolis Healthcare has launched a Centre for Genomics to expand its specialty diagnostics business. The company plans to increase its genomics test menu from 220 to 500 over the next two years and integrate testing with genetic counselling and clinical expertise. Specialty tests already contribute about 38% of revenue and are expected to grow further. Metropolis is targeting 13–15% organic growth in FY26 and FY27 and will continue selective acquisitions while expanding radiology services.

articles.title: Australia's US ambassador Kevin Rudd to step down early
articles.summary: Kevin Rudd steps down early as Australia’s ambassador to the United States after Trump criticism, will head Asia Society. Albanese confirms Rudd’s decision and praises his AUKUS and minerals work.

articles.title: Even after sharp rally, gold and silver still offer long-term value, say experts
articles.summary: Sachin Jain, CEO of the World Gold Council, highlighted that gold’s strength over the last 18 months has been supported by a mix of global factors. Rising global debt levels, particularly in the US, along with ongoing geopolitical tensions and trade-related uncertainties, have created a favourable backdrop for gold.

articles.title: World faces massive jobs test as 1.2 billion young people near working age: World Bank
articles.summary: The World Bank warns that 1.2 billion young people will enter developing-world labour markets by 2035, making job creation, investment and reforms critical to avoid unemployment and unrest.

articles.title: Global economy holds up despite trade tensions, but developing world still lags: World Bank
articles.summary: One in four developing economies remains poorer than before the pandemic; jobs challenge looms as 1.2 billion youth enter workforce

articles.title: Indian rice exports struggle, but home demand is rising: Kribhco Agri
articles.summary: Rajesh Paharia, Chief Manager–Business Development at Kribhco Agri Business, said Indian rice exporters were already facing delayed payments, currency weakness, banking constraints and rising logistics costs, and that the new tariff has compounded these challenges, increasing risks for those exposed to the Iranian market.

articles.title: Women still locked out of real finance despite 90% bank account coverage: Report
articles.summary: Inclusive Finance India Report 2025 flags inactive accounts, low financial literacy and a 35% MSME credit gap as key barriers to women’s economic agency.

articles.title: How AI can help Ujjwala deliver its next gains
articles.summary: AI can help India shift PMUY from mass access to precision—targeting electric cooking where grids allow, cutting LPG imports, subsidies, and sustaining clean-cooking gains nationwide.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Real estate sector seeks tax realism, faster approvals and infra-led growth
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 approaches, India’s real estate sector is seeking policy clarity on taxes, approvals and affordability as rising costs and shifting demand reshape the housing market. Developers say targeted reforms and infrastructure push could be critical to sustaining momentum across residential, commercial and Tier II city developments.

articles.title: US consumer prices likely stayed elevated in December as data recovers from shutdown
articles.summary: The figures are harder to predict this month, however, because the six-week government shutdown last fall suspended the collection of price data used to compile the inflation rate. Some economists expect the December figures to show a bigger jump in inflation as the data collection process gets back to normal.

articles.title: New labour rules will make hiring costlier, say staffing firms
articles.summary: Executives from TeamLease Services and Info Edge said India’s new labour codes will increase PF and ESI contributions due to a standardised wage definition, raising compliance costs for companies. However, TeamLease said the impact can be absorbed within one annual increment cycle. Info Edge cautioned that higher hiring costs may pressure corporate margins. For gig and quick commerce firms, the shift may largely replace private insurance spending with government social security contributions, li

articles.title: US-Taiwan trade deal on the horizon; focus on chipmaking in United States
articles.summary: As per reports, the import duties would drop from the current 20% to 15%. At that level, Taiwan's shipments would be comparable to those from South Korea and Japan, both of which signed deals last year.

articles.title: Japanese bonds decline as PM Takaichi gears up for political gamble
articles.summary: As rumours that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi could dissolve parliament and hold elections emerged, the yield on 30-year bonds increased by 12 basis points to 3.52%, while 10-year bond futures dropped by 71 ticks.

articles.title: No formal India-US trade talks scheduled this week despite Ambassador Gor’s remarks: Sources
articles.summary: Despite US Ambassador Sergio Gor signalling progress on India-US trade talks, Indian government sources say no formal discussions are scheduled this week. Informal engagement continues, and India’s participation in the US-led PAX Silica Initiative has boosted critical mineral stocks.

articles.title: CII asks govt to invest in railways and factories, cut fuel taxes, and put money back in people’s pockets
articles.summary: As Budget Day approaches, industry body CII is calling for a sharp increase in infrastructure spending, a renewed PPP push, and structural reforms in taxation and financing to revive consumption and strengthen manufacturing competitiveness.

articles.title: India Inc wants a GST-style customs reboot in Budget 2026 to cut delays and unlock cash
articles.summary: Industry experts say a GST-style overhaul of customs—covering duty slab rationalisation, deeper digitisation, and a one-time amnesty for legacy disputes—could significantly reduce clearance delays, unlock stuck working capital, and improve India’s trade competitiveness in the coming years.

articles.title: RBI notifies Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) Regulations, 2026
articles.summary: RBI’s new Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) Regulations, 2026, bar residents from participating in guarantees involving non-residents unless FEMA-compliant, expand guarantee definitions, and mandate quarterly reporting through AD banks with penalties for delays.

articles.title: Cheaper food drags retail inflation down, but the relief may be short
articles.summary: Kotak Institutional Equities Chief Economist Suvodeep Rakshit said the December print gives the RBI comfort ahead of its February 6 MPC policy meeting, as inflation remains well below the lower bound of the target range.

articles.title: India's inflation at three-month high in December, but undershoots poll
articles.summary: India’s retail inflation came in at 1.33% in December, below CNBC-TV18 estimates, as soft food prices offset sequential pressure across rural, urban and core consumption segments.

articles.title: Indian banks look strongest in 15 years, but Crisil flags these risks
articles.summary: Krishnan Sitaraman, Chief Ratings Officer at Crisil Ratings, said the agency is closely monitoring pressure points, especially export-oriented sectors with exposure to the US market.

articles.title: The anatomy of India’s consumer sector: Has policy finally met behaviour?
articles.summary: Q3FY26 shows cautious recovery in India’s consumption, with rising credit card spends, strong rural auto sales, FMCG volume growth, and digital transactions, but urban demand remains subdued.

articles.title: Textile exporters struggle as US tariff pain drags on
articles.summary: Pallab Banerjee, MD & Group President of Pearl Global, said that many smaller textile players are likely to exit the business if the situation does not improve soon, which could lead to job losses and some factory closures in India.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026: Here is all you need to know about this crucial document on state of the economy
articles.summary: Presented in Parliament a day before the Budget, the Economic Survey is best described as India’s economic report card and roadmap rolled into one. It reviews how the economy performed over the fiscal year, from growth, inflation, and jobs to trade and fiscal health — and flags challenges and opportunities.

articles.title: Donald Trump denies role in DoJ's investigation into Fed chair Jerome Powell
articles.summary: Trump denied any role in DOJ subpoenas tied to the Federal Reserve as Powell warned of political pressure and lawmakers raised concerns about the Fed’s independence.

articles.title: Finance Minister chairs pre-Budget consultation with States, UTs ahead of Budget 2026
articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman chaired a pre-Budget meeting in New Delhi with States and Union Territories ahead of the 2026–27 Union Budget, set for February 1, marking her ninth presentation.

articles.title: Shed colonial mindset, trust Indian capability: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to railway officials
articles.summary: Addressing senior officials at the Ati Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar ceremony, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw laid out a reform-driven roadmap for Indian Railways, emphasising technology adoption, safety, advanced training and wider collaboration with startups to position the national transporter as a global benchmark by 2047.

articles.title: India confident of dealing with headwinds from ‘known, unknown sources’: Principal Secy to PM Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Principal Secretary to the PM Shaktikanta Das highlights India's resilience amid global shocks, outlining challenges and strategies for Viksit Bharat and continued economic growth.

articles.title: Government plans changes to National Highways Act to fast-track road projects
articles.summary: The government is considering amendments to the National Highways Act to ease land acquisition, cut litigation and speed up highway construction, with proposals likely to be tabled in Parliament’s Budget Session.

articles.title: CBIC flags fake GST notices, advises taxpayers to verify DIN
articles.summary: The CBIC on Friday flagged fake GST notices being sent to businesses and asked taxpayers to report such frauds immediately.

articles.title: US adds fewer jobs than expected in December, unemployment rate declines
articles.summary: US job growth cooled sharply in December, with weak hiring, downward revisions and mixed labour signals, even as falling unemployment and strong consumption kept the broader economic outlook resilient.

articles.title: India cuts US Treasury holdings by 21% in 2025, signals reserve diversification
articles.summary: India’s US Treasury holdings fell 21% to $190.7 billion dollars in 2025, reflecting a strategic shift toward gold and non-dollar assets amid global uncertainty.

articles.title: UBS explains why the rupee’s troubles may not be over yet
